byline.contributor: Kiki Zhao, Mia Li, Adam Wu and Shanshan Wang contributed research.

abstract: Documentary film Under the Dome is deleted from major Chinese websites on orders of Communist Party's propaganda department; video had caused national stir over country's air pollution problem and was viewed hundreds of millions of times on Internet in week since its release.
lead_paragraph: “Under the Dome” had hundreds of millions of views on Chinese websites within days of its release, more than any other video in recent years, but websites were promptly ordered to delete it.

headline.main: China Blocks Web Access to ‘Under the Dome’ Documentary on Pollution
headline.print_headline: China Blocks Web Access to Video About Country’s Rampant Air Pollution

snippet: “Under the Dome” had hundreds of millions of views on Chinese websites within days of its release, more than any other video in recent years, but websites were promptly ordered to delete it.
